e4: As a board member, I recommend changing to the new policy for maintaining transparency and integrity in financial reporting despite potential market volatility or short-term negative impact on stock pricing. It is imperative that the firm avoids any legal liability, SEC investigations or criticism from investors, and adheres to ethical principles in its reporting practices.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should uphold transparency, accuracy, consistency and fairness in financial reporting. While current practices may be consistent and understood by investors, their biased nature can potentially expose the company to legal liability or investigations. A new policy without bias will provide more accurate information, maintaining integrity and fostering trust among all stakeholders.
e6: It appears that the management team has concerns about communicating the change to a new policy without bias, particularly the potential short-term impact on stock prices and investor relations. However, it would be important to have further questions regarding specific plans for changing communication strategies to minimize the negative effects of the change and protect retail investors from manipulation by sophisticated hedge funds.
